content: I used this quote incessantly when building design-led engineering organizations. Engineering best-practices, and disciplines such as agile or software craftsmanship rightly obsess about “doing things right”. But design-thinking; making sure you frame the problem through the lens of a user need and then designing a solution towards that need, ensured that first we were “doing the right thing”. Ultimately, this means that the single metric that matters is a measure to the degree with which you’ve anesthetized the user-pain — Net Promoter Score (NPS). One of the best pieces of advice I received when socializing my company to investors at the idea stage, was from Rob Coneybeer, who encouraged me to design for NPS.
